content.title: Scheme for Grant of Additional Scholarship to the Students of Other Backward Classes of Andaman and Nicobar Islands, for Pursuing Higher Studies Anywhere in India after Secondary Level (Except Class XI & XII)
content.department: Department of Social Welfare, Union Territory of Andaman and Nicobar Islands
content.details: The scheme provides additional financial assistance (Scholarship) to the OBC students belonging to the non-creamy layer of Andaman & Nicobar Islands for pursuing higher education after Secondary (X)/Senior Secondary (XII), in Government-recognized Polytechnic/ITI/College/University anywhere in India, as an incentive to supplement the cost of their education.
benefits: Scholarship payable for a duration of ten months in an academic session
Direct credit of scholarship amount to Aadhaar-linked bank account
eligibility: Students belonging to a non-creamy layer of OBC of the Andaman and Nicobar Islands
Students who have passed Secondary (Class X)/Senior Secondary (Class XII) from a recognized Board of School Education
Only two children of the same parent/guardian are entitled to receive this scholarship
exclusions: Students repeating the same stage/level of education/course
Students pursuing another professional course after completing one
Courses funded by the Central Government or State Government or UT Administration
documents_required: Caste certificate signed by an authorized revenue officer
Receipt of acknowledgment of the scholarship in the previous year (if applicable)
Copy of marks statement for renewal of the scholarship

faqs.question: What is the objective of the scheme?
faqs.answer: To provide additional financial assistance (Scholarship) to the OBC students belonging to the non-creamy layer of Andaman & Nicobar Islands for pursuing higher education.

faqs.question: Which is the implementing department of this scheme?
faqs.answer: Department of Social Welfare, Andaman and Nicobar Administration.

faqs.question: Who is eligible to apply under the scheme?
faqs.answer: Students who belong to OBCs specified and notified in relation to Andaman and Nicobar Islands and are domicile of Andaman & Nicobar Islands.

faqs.question: What is the benefit of the scheme?
faqs.answer: An amount of ₹1000/- per month shall be sanctioned to the eligible students.

faqs.question: How to apply for this scholarship?
faqs.answer: Online submission of the application form can be done through the National Scholarship Portal.
